original: Bohm, Yngve Carl Herman, bitr. förste provinsialläkare, Halmstad, f. 27/1/95 i Lund av dir. Herman B. o. Augusta Norlting. G. 23 m. Linnéa Tolf. Barn: Ulla f. 24, Jöran 25, Ber|til 28, Gösta 29. — Stud:ex. i Linköp. 13, med. kand. i Sthlm 16, med. lic. där 23. Tf. und :läk. v. Linköp. las. 20-22, tf. förste undiläk. där två mån. 23-24, tf. provrläk. i Grönskåra distr. 23, undiläk. v. Varbergs las. 24, förste undiläk. v. Garnisjukh. i Sthlm kir. avd. 25-26, proviläk. i Gäddede distr. 26-31, i Halmstads distr, sed. 31, bitr. förste proviläk. i Hall. 1. sed. 32, läk. v. post- o. telegriv. sed. 32, v. Halmistad-Nässjö Järnv. 32-45. Sv-RKSM.
translated: Bohm, Yngve Carl Herman, deputy chief district medical officer, Halmstad, born on January 27, 1895 in Lund to director Herman B. and Augusta Norlting. Married on the 23rd with Linnéa Tolf. Children: Ulla born in 1924, Jöran in 1925, Bertil in 1928, Gösta in 1929. He graduated from Linköping secondary school in 1913 and obtained a Bachelor of Medicine degree in Stockholm in 1916, followed by a medical license there in 1923. He served as a temporary assistant doctor at the Linköping hospital from 1920-1922, temporary first assistant doctor there for two months in 1923-1924, temporary district medical officer in the Grönskåra district in 1923, assistant doctor at the Varberg hospital in 1924, first assistant doctor at the surgical department of the Stockholm garrison hospital from 1925-1926, district medical officer in the Gäddede district from 1926-1931, in the Halmstad district since 1931, deputy first district medical officer in Halland since 1932, and physician for the post and telegraph service and for the Halmstad-Nässjö Railway from 1932-1945. He was awarded the Swedish Royal Order of the Polar Star.

memberOf.name: Swedish Royal Order of the Polar Star
